intro: Didymoglossum curtii, commonly known as the small-leafed moss, is a member of the family Pottiaceae and is characterized by its small, densely packed leaves. It is a cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The leaves are usually narrow and have a distinct midrib, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. This moss is often found growing on soil or rock surfaces, forming dense, cushion-like mats. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature.
